Author: blackjok3r#3181

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The burn tx, is a very simple tx... It is a coins sent to OP_RETURN (which means they are burnt) and in that OP_RETURN is the tx itself... So that the import chain can deocde it for needed information. You can only migrate coins at this stage ... I would say its posible to migrate small amounts of data with modification, but it would be a hard fork... In fact thats exactly what we just did... We added more data to the migrate burn tx so that it contains the name of the chain the burn happened on, as previously that was un knowable.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
OK so, what we will do here. We should keep CFEK... It will no longer be a cluster, it can be oracles chain. Its already full of oracles so we may as well leave it as that.. It will be a good test to try and speed those up some more, they can still be slow on validation. 
There will be 2 new chains cluster 105, just and only for testing migrates. To make sure this new hardforking change is stable, and the new `getimport` rpc works. These two can also be used to create the stats gathering scripts for the oracle project of @CrisF 's . I will need to leave here for a fair while soon, so hopefully we get it started, and enough people have updated by the time I get home and we cna get testing. üòÉ

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
we inherited some build bug from upstream... either that or me disabling komodo-tx has broken it... it does build.
``` ./stop.sh
cd ~/komodo
git pull
./zctuil/build.sh -j8
git clean -f
make -j8
(might need git clean and make again)
cd ~/StakedNotary
git pull
./start.sh```
